description.p: You learn how to bend shadows from your experience with the Shadowfell. You gain the following benefits:

ul.li: Increase your Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma score by 1, to a maximum of 20.

You learn the invisibility spell and one 1st-level spell of your choice. The 1st-level spell must be from the illusion or necromancy school of magic. You can cast each of these spells without expending a spell slot. Once you cast either of these spells in this way, you can’t cast that spell in this way again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast these spells using spell slots you have of the appropriate level. The spells’ spellcasting ability is the ability increased by this feat.

sheet.description: You can cast your chosen spells without expending a spell slot. You can also cast these spells using spell slots you have of the appropriate level.

description.p: While wearing this circlet, the wearer's Charisma score decreases by 2. They also have advantage on initiative rolls. When making an attack roll, the wearer can use their reaction to gain a +5 bonus to the roll. They make this choice after they see the roll, but before the DM says whether the attack hits or misses. The wearer cannot use this ability again until they finish a short or long rest.

sheet.description: You have advantage on initiative rolls. When making an attack roll, use your reaction to gain a +5 bonus to the roll.

description.p: As a bonus action, three (or however many are remaining for the day) twisting, whistling, hypoallergenic, gluten-free darts of magical force appear in a triangle floating behind your head. When an enemy gets within ten feet of you, you may target them with 1-3 missiles. Make a ranged spell attack for each missile. On a hit, the missile does 2d4 force damage. If the attack roll scores a critical, the missile does 5d4 force damage instead of the 4d4 force that you would normally get on a critical. If any of the attack roll is a natural one, all missiles turn around and hit the caster for 3 force damage per missile. Regains all missiles at dawn. Missiles can not trigger on your turn. Missiles only trigger when someone enters the radius, starting within the zone or teleporting in do not activate missiles.

Ondros used to wield a quarterstaff on his travels. That staff is long since broken and now serves as these two clubs. Adorned with years of experience and use, these clubs have served Ondros well and could tell a lifetime worth of stories.

Ondros has taken to collecting the pistols off of his notable enemies. Whether it was the novelty of the new technology or knowing that he doesn't know how to use them, Ondros seems driven to hoarding these metal contraptions.

You create a long, shadow- like whip emanating from your right hand that lashes out at a creature in range. Make a melee spell attack against the target. If the attack hits, the creature takes 1d8 necrotic damage, and if the creature is Large or smaller, you pull the creature up to 10 feet closer to you.

setters.set: the stem of a plant with thorns

description.p: A Loxodon druid from the eastern savannahs of Rodethan, Ondros the Healer studies the druidic ideals of love and respect for nature. After learning all he could from his home tribe, he set off on a pilgrimage in search of the fabled druidic circle of the shepherd. Ondros spent one last night with his wife, Rena, before he departed and promised to return to her following the completion of his training. During his travels he stumbled upon the Rubicon Corporation trying to establish a loggin camp on a sacred and ancient grove. Ondros sabotaged the loggers equipment and quickly fled feeling good about saving the grove. He quickly realized that Rubicon had put a hit out on him, and that he was being hunted by mercenaries. Through luck and sheer force of will, Ondros was able to make it to the Kingdom of Kariellum. With mercenaries quick on his tail, he was forced to forgo an immediate trip to the druidic circle and sought refuge in the dwarven/gnome city of Twincrown. Unfortunately, while posing as a horse in front of a tavern, they were discovered. The hired thugs attacked, and all seemed lost. With a merry tune and an angelic voice, a halfling bard named Wayne stepped in to help. The two couldn't defeat all the mercenaries, but managed to bartered for their lives. They were thrown into an indentured servitude camp, deep below Twincrown. Over the next three months they became close with a pirate who organized an escape plan with the two. Finally free, Ondros and Wayne fled to Chinook fearing the Rubicon Corporation. Now they find themselves in Rigmoore thanks to an unusual sign you received from the Wildmother.

ul.li: Tool Proficiencies: One type of gaming set
Languages: Choose one of Celestial, Draconic, Goblin, or Minotaur
Equipment: Your wits and whatever you were able to hold onto between shipwrecks.

description.p: Coming from a land of peace, where nature reigns, never forget your connection to home.

select.name: Personality Trait
select.item: Your love for nature and its versatility inspires you to find new uses for its materials, you love scavenging natural materials for your crafts.

select.name: Ideal
select.item: I must protect what I care about, but life on the run has made me wary for my own survival. (Chaotic)

select.name: Bond
select.item: The last few years have felt like several lifetimes, I have become accustomed to loosing friends.

select.name: Flaw
select.item: My time on the run has made me forget about the past.

description.p: You have long enjoyed the power and curiosity of flame. Acting both predictibly and erratic the nature of flame has always loomed in the back of your mind. Over many years your have sought to learn more about the primordial nature of fire itself granting you limited number of extra fire spells to your available spell list.

description.p: For you, the spells on the Pyromaniac Spells table are added to the spell list of your spellcasting class. (If you are a multiclass character with multiple spell lists, these spells are added to all of them.)
Your magic often features dramatic bursts of flame or radiance. When you cast beneficial spells on your allies, they appear momentarily surrounded with halos of bright fire.
